page.title: 12LANDSCAPE DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: These 12 square kilometres are a plateau of agricultural land dissected by the steep sided valley of the 'Seaton'.To the west of the river traditional smallfield (2-6 acres) farming mostly sheep and cattle;to the east the more intensive cultivation of grain, potatoes & sheep predominate. The valley is heavily wooded,much of it 'old field' as afforestation fills the difficult slopes.On the east facing slope the Duchy and others have planted conifers.West facing slopes are overmature oak woodland in need of sympathetic management.The valley and its woods warrant their designation as an area of landscape value,proposed to become A.O.N.B.Sadly the valley bottom retains an early permit to develop as a large caravan site which,if the intermittent flooding allows,will make a mockery of the structure plan.
